text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Wikinews interviews Christopher Hill, U.S. Republican Party presidential candidate
text.summary1: (human1) Wikinews interviews Christopher Hill, a former US Air Force fighter pilot, about his ongoing primary campaign as a Republican presidential candidate, his goals and reasons for running, his support of the Republican party, and his views on President Obama's performance ahead of the 2016 elections.
text.summary2: (human2) Christopher Hill is being interviewed by Wikinews, for he is running to be the Republican party presidential candidate in the 2012 election.
text.summary3: (human3) Christopher Hill, a former United States Air Force Officer who now hopes to run for president with the Republican Party, wants to use the platform to help workers "from the heartland of America" who have been let down by "unconstitutional" behavior from "far left" presidents such as Barack Obama.
text.summary4: (human4) A former Air Force officer, running as a Republican presidential candidate, commits in an interview to adhering to U.S. Constitutional law and shifting government focus towards supporting working-class Americans over Ivy League elites, suggesting working-class perspectives from the heartland are necessary to restore national stability.
text.summary5: (human5) In an interview with Wikinews, Christopher Hill, U.S. Republican Party presidential candidate, explains that his reasons for running for president constitute implementing policies that support working class Americans.
